EmmanuelAmuneke's meteoric rise to the highest pedestal of the African continent as a footballer does not come to many as a sur- prise, he had within hisshortstay in the limelight displayed traits of a prince hoping to become the king one day. And the day came lastSundaywhen heemerged from the blues, beating other world- class players like Rashidi Yekini, Goerge Weah [Liberian who plays for Paris St. German in France]. to book a ticket to the All African Games in 1991. Of course, they did by white- washing the Ivorien Under-23 team 3-0 on aggregate. It was during this encounter that the dribbling skills of the left footer came to focus. Imbibed with the rare potential to take pow- erful shots while in motion, no matter the distance [closeness] of the ball to him, Amuneke shone like a thousand stars. It was this first experience that prepared the lethal winger for the greater confrontations in life which has taken him to Egypt and now Portugal. Finidi's transfer from Sharks of Port Harcourt to Dutch first division side Ajax was last season most surprising move. With his dribbling runs along the flanks, he has contributed Im- mensely to Ajax success in the Dutch league and European cup champion- ships. Fast and concise with his pull outs. Finidi is a success ory as far as Super Eagles participation is con- cerned. He has within a short period on the international scene created a n/che for himself. Tied on the same position with Austin Okocha, Oliseh cuts the image of an innocent church lay reader. But he is not that Innocent when It comes to making defence splitting passes. Within a short pe- riod of establishing himself on the International scene at Standard Liege of Belgium, he has come to be recognised by CAF. He holds the record of being the first African player to feature in the Italian Serie A who mid this year, he signed to play for Reggiana. Oliseh is a de- fensive midfielder with great acumen. Amuneke's exploits in the World Cup endeared him to the Portuguese club, Sporting Lisbon which opened up discussion with him and finally signed him on in October. The Confederation of African Football's [CAF's] award to him as the Continent's player of the year, Succeeding another Nigerian, Rashidi Yekini, is a bold recognition of natural talent, achievements and an encompassing ambassadorial trait.
